Notes.Text:
This update for python-numpy fixes the following issues:

- CVE-2021-41495: Fixed Null Pointer Dereference in numpy.sort (bsc#1193911).
Notes.Title: Details

Notes.Text: The CVRF data is provided by SUSE under the Creative Commons License 4.0 with Attribution (CC-BY-4.0).
Notes.Title: Terms of Use

Relationships.RelatesToProductReference: SUSE Linux Enterprise Server for SAP Applications 12 SP5
SUSE Linux Enterprise Software Development Kit 12 SP5

Vulnerabilities.Description: ** DISPUTED ** Null Pointer Dereference vulnerability exists in numpy.sort in NumPy &lt and 1.19 in the PyArray_DescrNew function due to missing return-value validation, which allows attackers to conduct DoS attacks by repetitively creating sort arrays. NOTE: While correct that validation is missing, an error can only occur due to an exhaustion of memory. If the user can exhaust memory, they are already privileged. Further, it should be practically impossible to construct an attack which can target the memory exhaustion to occur at exactly this place.

ProductID: SUSE Linux Enterprise Server for SAP Applications 12 SP5:python-numpy-1.8.0-5.14.1
SUSE Linux Enterprise Software Development Kit 12 SP5:python-numpy-devel-1.8.0-5.14.1
